meanings.definition: To form or unite in a group or organization.
meanings.sent1: The students brigaded together to clean up the park.
meanings.sent2: The workers brigaded to demand better working conditions.
meanings.sent3: The ants brigaded to carry the food back to their nest.
meanings.sent4: The stars brigaded in the night sky, creating a beautiful pattern.
meanings.sent5: The colorful birds brigaded in the trees, chirping happily.

meanings.definition: To organize into a group for a common purpose.
meanings.sent1: The team brigaded to plan their strategy for the game.
meanings.sent2: The community brigaded to raise funds for a local charity.
meanings.sent3: The toys brigaded together to surprise the child with a party.
meanings.sent4: The clouds brigaded in the sky, blocking the sun's rays.
meanings.sent5: The flowers brigaded in the garden, blooming in harmony.
